results.title: New York Renters Are Now Paying the Price for the ‘Covid Discount’
results.abstract: More than 40 percent of the available units in Manhattan currently come from tenants priced out of apartments they leased in 2020 and 2021, according to a new StreetEasy report.

media.caption: Cathy Linh Che scrambled to find another apartment in the Two Bridges neighborhood in Manhattan after the rent on her pandemic-deal apartment increased by 65 percent.

results.title: He’s Baseball’s Only Mud Supplier. It’s a Job He May Soon Lose.
results.abstract: Jim Bintliff collects the Delaware River mud that is smeared on Major League baseballs to make them less slippery. But that tradition is in jeopardy.

media.caption: Jim Bintliff and his family have been selling Delaware River mud to Major League Baseball for decades. Here, he fills a bucket in New Jersey.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.title: Few Parents Intend to Have Very Young Children Vaccinated Against Covid
results.abstract: In a new survey, 43 percent of parents of children ages 6 months through 4 years said they would refuse the shots for their kids. An additional 27 percent were uncertain.

results.title: Facing ‘Putin’s Energy Blackmail,’ Europe Agrees to Cut Russian Gas Use
results.abstract: Holding together despite some nations’ dependence on Russia, the European Union agreed to make voluntary savings mandatory if the Kremlin suddenly decides to turn off the taps over its invasion of Ukraine.

media.caption: A gas storage plant near Eiterfeld, Germany, this month. Russia’s state-owned gas monopoly, Gazprom, said this week it would further reduce the natural gas it sends to Germany through the Nord Stream 1 pipeline.

results.title: Joni Mitchell Performs Surprise Show at Newport Folk Festival
results.abstract: The 78-year-old artist performed a full set, her first in about two decades, at the renowned festival in Rhode Island on Sunday.

media.caption: Joni Mitchell, who has rarely appeared in public in recent years, performed some of her most iconic songs, including an extended guitar solo on “Just Like This Train” from her “Court and Spark” album.

results.title: Ukraine Is the Next Act in Putin’s Empire of Humiliation

results.title: Russia Says It Will Quit the International Space Station After 2024
results.abstract: The withdrawal would end two decades of post-Cold War cooperation in space between the United States and Russia, which jointly built and operate the station.

media.caption: The International Space Station, photographed from a Russian spacecraft in 2018, was built as a symbol of post-Cold War cooperation between the world’s space superpowers.
